basics.name: Alex Fenwick
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Robotics Engineering and a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering at Worcester Polytechnic Institute. I expect to graduate in May 2027.

work.company: Consolidated School District of New Britain

highlights: Developed an Angular-based website to efficiently process and display data, enhancing data accessibility for the team.
Worked with teams from around the world to develop effective strategies.
Utilized SOLIDWORKS to design a competitive robot with a 3DoF arm.
Utilized SOLIDWORKS PDM and ONSHAPE to work together with my team to design a world class robot.
Used Fusion CAM to cut parts out of Aluminum, Poly-carbonate, and other composites on CNC machinery.
Helped coordinate and develop strategy used by the team during competition.

projects.name: Andymark Robits FTC Curriculum
projects.description: Developed mechanical lessons for an adaptable robotics curriculum for middle schoolers based around an existing set of parts.
highlights: Worked with a team of others to integrate lessons into a cohesive curriculum.
Explained basic mechanical concepts that relate to robotics.

projects.name: RBE 1001 - Autonomous Fruit Picking Robot
projects.description: Collaborated with a team to create a small autonomous robot to collect and deliver 3D printed 'fruit'.
highlights: Designed and Programmed (Python) an four bar, elevator, and unconventional drive train to utilize cameras, gyros, and encoder feedback with state machines.
Designed and 3D printed parts to interface with a given kit of parts.

projects.name: RBE 2001
projects.description: Utilized SOLIDWORKS FEA to analyze stress and structural integrity.
highlights: Utilized Inverse Kinematics to control a double jointed arm in order to draw different images and move to different points.
Controlled servos, brushed motors, and brushless motors, ESCs, and read encoder values through an Arduino.
